block.p: * Paul Hammersley was named to the new position of senior vice president and head of client services and new business at the Lowe Group North America, New York. He was previously a group director at Saatchi & Saatchi, London. * James J. Spanfeller was named associate publisher for advertising at Inc. magazine, New York, succeeding Kristin Norrgard, now publisher at Working Woman magazine. Mr. Spanfeller was previously senior vice president and associate publisher at Playboy magazine, New York.

* Paul Hammersley was named to the new position of senior vice president and head of client services and new business at the Lowe Group North America, New York. He was previously a group director at Saatchi & Saatchi, London. * James J. Spanfeller was named associate publisher for advertising at Inc. magazine, New York, succeeding Kristin Norrgard, now publisher at Working Woman magazine. Mr. Spanfeller was previously senior vice president and associate publisher at Playboy magazine, New York.

* Lisa Henriques was named advertising director at Vanity Fair magazine, New York, succeeding Victoria Lasdon, who has taken a leave of absence. Ms. Henriques previously held the same position at Allure magazine, which, like Vanity Fair, is owned by Conde Nast. Also at Vanity Fair, Jean M. Karlson was named to the new position of director of marketing services. She previously held a similar position at Allure. And Stephen Jacoby, the director of marketing and creative services, was promoted to the new position of director of marketing and business development. * Rocky MacMahon was named to the new position of creative director at Lewis & Gace Europa, Winchester, England. He was most recently a partner and creative director at Bungey Medical Advertising Ltd., London. * Donald Daniel and Stephen Judge, executive vice presidents at Rapp Collins Marcoa, Dallas, were named to the new positions of co-managing directors. * Mario Cooper was named a senior vice president at Porter/Novelli, Washington. He had been deputy chief of staff at the Democratic National Committee, Washington.
